application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T.2821 Sweet Chestnut - Fell (advanced honey fungus). T.2805 Deodar Cedar - 1-2m reduction of eastmost branches. 1m reduction of upper southern branch to reduce sail effect. T.2822 Atlas Cedar - 1-2m reduction of lower over extended east, south and north branches to height of 12m - reduction to tie into main canopy form. Do not thin. T.2830 English Oak - 3m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points & deadwood. T.2831 Deodar Cedar - 2m reduction of overextended laterals to suitable growth points. T.2832 Horse Chestnut - 2m holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points & deadwood.T.2833 English Oak - 3m reduction of northern primary branches & deadwood. T.2835 English Oak - 2-3m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points & deadwood. T.nbr3 Common Lime - 2m reduction off client property & deadwood. T.2817 Sequoia - Aerial inspection for compromised branches in upper canopy and storm damaged hung branches. Remove or reduce damaged rubbing laterals. T.nbr1 English Oak - 1-2m reduction off property & deadwood. T.2801 Sycamore - 1-2m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points & deadwood. T.2828 Golden Robinia - Lateral reduction to suitable growth points providing 2m clearance. T.2804 Himalyan Birch - Cut back lower laterals to south and east to provide unobstructed access to car park. T.2806 Yew - Crown lift to 3m from ground level over carpark. T.2808 Yew - Crown lift to 5m from ground level & reduce south canopy to provide clearance over roadway. T.nbr2 Beech - 2m lateral reduction to a height of 6m from ground level.
